Comment: >It also found that while 60 percent think Trump is out of touch with the concerns of most people in the United States and 39 percent think he is in touch with them, 69 percent think the Democratic Party is out of touch and 30 percent think the party is in touch with American's concerns.  The moderate/right-wing majority in the Democrat party refuses to budge on for-profit healthcare, dragged their feet with student loans, and did nothing about the housing crisis. Probably the three biggest, most in-your-face problems we've had over the last 5+ years and it seems like they have zero plans on addressing any of those issues.  Progressives are gaining steam by making those issues their focal points but between Republican voters thinking anything that helps Americans is the devil's communism and ye olde Democrats not wanting to lose their corporate sponsors, it doesn't seem like we'll see any real solutions for the rest of this decade.   Tbh, we might need Trump to just implode the whole thing to actually get a Progressive majority in here so we can actually fix problems.
